intro: Clidemia fendleri, commonly known as Hawaiian baby woodrose, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and rocky slopes. It is an evergreen shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Clidemia fendleri plays a role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
